result.execSummary:
The defendant Monique Shauntay Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**10-26-15/ Judge Rebecca F Dallet**

miscConds.notes: AS TO THIS CASE:  Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, except any applicable mandatory surcharges. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Full time work and/or school.  Obtain GED/HSED.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medication and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.

No violent  contact with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrests.
No physicial punishment or use of any objects to punish.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete anger management counseling and a parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Comply with all ordrs of the MBCW.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully comlplete recommended treatment including random urine srcreens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/13/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling and a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-No phsyical punishment or use of any objects to punish.  
-Comply with all orders of the MBCW.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, except any applicable mandatory surcharges.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Full time work and/or school.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. Defendant Monique Shauntay Allen in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Monique Shauntay Allen in custody.  Sara N Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Monique Shauntay Allen not in court.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
